intro: Hypolytrum longifolium subsp. longifolium, commonly known as the long-leaved hypolytrum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces showy, spike-like inflorescences with pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
